oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gilt-handled walking cane presented to Col. Henry L. Giltner
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Col. Giltner commanded the 4th KY Cav. Regt. CSA, part of John Hunt Morgan's cavalry. Giltner's unit was part of the cavalry detailed to guard Greeneville, Tenn. on the night of Sept. 3, 1864 when Gen. Morgan was killed outside the Williams house in town. The handle of the cane is inscribed "Col. H. L. Giltner from Members of 4th Ky. Calvary[sic] C.S.A. July 22 [18]91"; the cane was apparently given to Giltner by veterans of his unit.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
